result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deondra D Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deondra D Jones not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Deondra D Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Calendar call scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Deondra D Jones not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Deondra D Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant could not appear due to medical issues. Appearance waived. Defense has discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Deondra D Jones in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deondra D Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-18-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Icon Store at Mayfair Mall.

Defendant Deondra D Jones in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Branch 13, RESERVE JUDGES, in Room 508 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/2022 @2p
